poem:
"In Memory of a Cyclist Visionary"

Under the brush of morning,
Tim spun songs in painted motion.
Charity-wrapped and wisdom-spoken,
a playful road of lives awoken.

Danced he, age upon a wheel,
supporting youth with older zeal.
An enterprise, his canvas stroked,
in cycling path, his life evoked.

His melody is left unheard,
yet echoes in each pedal turned.
A gifted man, as short-lived comets,
we ponder on, in silent sonnets.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tim Joss obituary My husband, Tim Joss, who has died aged 68 in a cycling accident, was a social entrepreneur and chief executive and founder of Arts Enterprise With a Social Purpose (Aesop). He was a visionary and established several other national organisations. Tim founded Aesop in 2014. The charity has gone on to pioneer arts solutions to society’s problems, most notably with Dance to Health, a falls prevention programme for older people. A gifted". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
